property.description: During the release of lease a lock is hold that make any operations on the namenode stuck. In order to not block them during a too long duration we stop releasing lease after this max lock limit.

property.name: dfs.namenode.write-lock-reporting-threshold-ms
property.description: When a write lock is held on the namenode for a long time, this will be logged as the lock is released. This sets how long the lock must be held for logging to occur.

property.name: dfs.namenode.read-lock-reporting-threshold-ms
property.description: When a read lock is held on the namenode for a long time, this will be logged as the lock is released. This sets how long the lock must be held for logging to occur.

property.name: dfs.namenode.lock.detailed-metrics.enabled
property.description: If true, the namenode will keep track of how long various operations hold the Namesystem lock for and emit this as metrics. These metrics have names of the form FSN(Read|Write)LockNanosOperationName, where OperationName denotes the name of the operation that initiated the lock hold (this will be OTHER for certain uncategorized operations) and they export the hold time values in nanoseconds.

property.name: dfs.namenode.fslock.fair
property.description: If this is true, the FS Namesystem lock will be used in Fair mode, which will help to prevent writer threads from being starved, but can provide lower lock throughput. See java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock for more information on fair/non-fair locks.

property.name: dfs.namenode.startup.delay.block.deletion.sec
property.description: The delay in seconds at which we will pause the blocks deletion after Namenode startup. By default it's disabled. In the case a directory has large number of directories and files are deleted, suggested delay is one hour to give the administrator enough time to notice large number of pending deletion blocks and take corrective action.

property.name: dfs.datanode.block.id.layout.upgrade.threads
property.description: The number of threads to use when creating hard links from current to previous blocks during upgrade of a DataNode to block ID-based block layout (see HDFS-6482 for details on the layout).

property.name: dfs.namenode.list.encryption.zones.num.responses
property.description: When listing encryption zones, the maximum number of zones that will be returned in a batch. Fetching the list incrementally in batches improves namenode performance.

property.name: dfs.namenode.list.reencryption.status.num.responses
property.description: When listing re-encryption status, the maximum number of zones that will be returned in a batch. Fetching the list incrementally in batches improves namenode performance.

property.name: dfs.namenode.list.openfiles.num.responses
property.description: When listing open files, the maximum number of open files that will be returned in a single batch. Fetching the list incrementally in batches improves namenode performance.

property.name: dfs.namenode.edekcacheloader.interval.ms
property.description: When KeyProvider is configured, the interval time of warming up edek cache on NN starts up / becomes active. All edeks will be loaded from KMS into provider cache. The edek cache loader will try to warm up the cache until succeed or NN leaves active state.

property.name: dfs.namenode.edekcacheloader.initial.delay.ms
property.description: When KeyProvider is configured, the time delayed until the first attempt to warm up edek cache on NN start up / become active.

property.name: dfs.namenode.reencrypt.sleep.interval
property.description: Interval the re-encrypt EDEK thread sleeps in the main loop. The interval accepts units. If none given, millisecond is assumed.

property.name: dfs.namenode.reencrypt.batch.size
property.description: How many EDEKs should the re-encrypt thread process in one batch.

property.name: dfs.namenode.reencrypt.throttle.limit.handler.ratio
property.description: Throttling ratio for the re-encryption, indicating what fraction of time should the re-encrypt handler thread work under NN read lock. Larger than 1.0 values are interpreted as 1.0. Negative value or 0 are invalid values and will fail NN startup.

property.name: dfs.namenode.reencrypt.throttle.limit.updater.ratio
property.description: Throttling ratio for the re-encryption, indicating what fraction of time should the re-encrypt updater thread work under NN write lock. Larger than 1.0 values are interpreted as 1.0. Negative value or 0 are invalid values and will fail NN startup.

property.name: dfs.namenode.reencrypt.edek.threads
property.description: Maximum number of re-encrypt threads to contact the KMS and re-encrypt the edeks.

property.name: dfs.namenode.inotify.max.events.per.rpc
property.description: Maximum number of events that will be sent to an inotify client in a single RPC response. The default value attempts to amortize away the overhead for this RPC while avoiding huge memory requirements for the client and NameNode (1000 events should consume no more than 1 MB.)

property.name: dfs.user.home.dir.prefix
property.description: The directory to prepend to user name to get the user's home direcotry.

property.name: dfs.datanode.cache.revocation.timeout.ms
property.description: When the DFSClient reads from a block file which the DataNode is caching, the DFSClient can skip verifying checksums. The DataNode will keep the block file in cache until the client is done. If the client takes an unusually long time, though, the DataNode may need to evict the block file from the cache anyway. This value controls how long the DataNode will wait for the client to release a replica that it is reading without checksums.

property.name: dfs.datanode.cache.revocation.polling.ms
property.description: How often the DataNode should poll to see if the clients have stopped using a replica that the DataNode wants to uncache.

property.name: dfs.storage.policy.enabled
property.description: Allow users to change the storage policy on files and directories.

property.name: dfs.namenode.legacy-oiv-image.dir
property.description: Determines where to save the namespace in the old fsimage format during checkpointing by standby NameNode or SecondaryNameNode. Users can dump the contents of the old format fsimage by oiv_legacy command. If the value is not specified, old format fsimage will not be saved in checkpoint.

property.name: dfs.namenode.top.enabled
property.description: Enable nntop: reporting top users on namenode

property.name: dfs.namenode.top.window.num.buckets
property.description: Number of buckets in the rolling window implementation of nntop

property.name: dfs.namenode.top.num.users
property.description: Number of top users returned by the top tool

property.name: dfs.namenode.top.windows.minutes
property.description: comma separated list of nntop reporting periods in minutes

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.ugi.expire.after.access
property.description: How long in milliseconds after the last access the cached UGI will expire. With 0, never expire.

property.name: dfs.namenode.blocks.per.postponedblocks.rescan
property.description: Number of blocks to rescan for each iteration of postponedMisreplicatedBlocks.

property.name: dfs.datanode.block-pinning.enabled
property.description: Whether pin blocks on favored DataNode.

property.name: dfs.client.block.write.locateFollowingBlock.initial.delay.ms
property.description: The initial delay (unit is ms) for locateFollowingBlock, the delay time will increase exponentially(double) for each retry.

property.name: dfs.ha.zkfc.nn.http.timeout.ms
property.description: The HTTP connection and read timeout value (unit is ms ) when DFS ZKFC tries to get local NN thread dump after local NN becomes SERVICE_NOT_RESPONDING or SERVICE_UNHEALTHY. If it is set to zero, DFS ZKFC won't get local NN thread dump.

property.name: dfs.ha.tail-edits.in-progress
property.description: Whether enable standby namenode to tail in-progress edit logs. Clients might want to turn it on when they want Standby NN to have more up-to-date data.

property.name: dfs.namenode.ec.system.default.policy
property.description: The default erasure coding policy name will be used on the path if no policy name is passed.

property.name: dfs.namenode.ec.policies.max.cellsize
property.description: The maximum cell size of erasure coding policy. Default is 4MB.

property.name: dfs.datanode.ec.reconstruction.stripedread.timeout.millis
property.description: Datanode striped read timeout in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.datanode.ec.reconstruction.stripedread.buffer.size
property.description: Datanode striped read buffer size.

property.name: dfs.datanode.ec.reconstruction.threads
property.description: Number of threads used by the Datanode for background reconstruction work.

property.name: dfs.datanode.ec.reconstruction.xmits.weight
property.description: Datanode uses xmits weight to calculate the relative cost of EC recovery tasks comparing to replicated block recovery, of which xmits is always 1. Namenode then uses xmits reported from datanode to throttle recovery tasks for EC and replicated blocks. The xmits of an erasure coding recovery task is calculated as the maximum value between the number of read streams and the number of write streams.

property.name: dfs.namenode.quota.init-threads
property.description: The number of concurrent threads to be used in quota initialization. The speed of quota initialization also affects the namenode fail-over latency. If the size of name space is big, try increasing this.

property.name: dfs.datanode.transfer.socket.send.buffer.size
property.description: Socket send buffer size for DataXceiver (mirroring packets to downstream in pipeline). This may affect TCP connection throughput. If it is set to zero or negative value, no buffer size will be set explicitly, thus enable tcp auto-tuning on some system. The default value is 0.

property.name: dfs.datanode.transfer.socket.recv.buffer.size
property.description: Socket receive buffer size for DataXceiver (receiving packets from client during block writing). This may affect TCP connection throughput. If it is set to zero or negative value, no buffer size will be set explicitly, thus enable tcp auto-tuning on some system. The default value is 0.

property.name: dfs.namenode.upgrade.domain.factor
property.description: This is valid only when block placement policy is set to BlockPlacementPolicyWithUpgradeDomain. It defines the number of unique upgrade domains any block's replicas should have. When the number of replicas is less or equal to this value, the policy ensures each replica has an unique upgrade domain. When the number of replicas is greater than this value, the policy ensures the number of unique domains is at least this value.

property.name: dfs.ha.zkfc.port
property.description: RPC port for Zookeeper Failover Controller.

property.name: dfs.datanode.bp-ready.timeout
property.description: The maximum wait time for datanode to be ready before failing the received request. Setting this to 0 fails requests right away if the datanode is not yet registered with the namenode. This wait time reduces initial request failures after datanode restart. Support multiple time unit suffix(case insensitive), as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval.

property.name: dfs.datanode.cached-dfsused.check.interval.ms
property.description: The interval check time of loading DU_CACHE_FILE in each volume. When the cluster doing the rolling upgrade operations, it will usually lead dfsUsed cache file of each volume expired and redo the du operations in datanode and that makes datanode start slowly. Adjust this property can make cache file be available for the time as you want.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.rest-csrf.enabled
property.description: If true, then enables WebHDFS protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF). The WebHDFS client also uses this property to determine whether or not it needs to send the custom CSRF prevention header in its HTTP requests.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.rest-csrf.custom-header
property.description: The name of a custom header that HTTP requests must send when protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF) is enabled for WebHDFS by setting dfs.webhdfs.rest-csrf.enabled to true. The WebHDFS client also uses this property to determine whether or not it needs to send the custom CSRF prevention header in its HTTP requests.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.rest-csrf.methods-to-ignore
property.description: A comma-separated list of HTTP methods that do not require HTTP requests to include a custom header when protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF) is enabled for WebHDFS by setting dfs.webhdfs.rest-csrf.enabled to true. The WebHDFS client also uses this property to determine whether or not it needs to send the custom CSRF prevention header in its HTTP requests.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.rest-csrf.browser-useragents-regex
property.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions used to match against an HTTP request's User-Agent header when protection against cross-site request forgery (CSRF) is enabled for WebHDFS by setting dfs.webhdfs.reset-csrf.enabled to true. If the incoming User-Agent matches any of these regular expressions, then the request is considered to be sent by a browser, and therefore CSRF prevention is enforced. If the request's User-Agent does not match any of these regular expressions, then the request is considered to be sent by something other than a browser, such as scripted automation. In this case, CSRF is not a potential attack vector, so the prevention is not enforced. This helps achieve backwards-compatibility with existing automation that has not been updated to send the CSRF prevention header.

property.name: dfs.xframe.enabled
property.description: If true, then enables protection against clickjacking by returning X_FRAME_OPTIONS header value set to SAMEORIGIN. Clickjacking protection prevents an attacker from using transparent or opaque layers to trick a user into clicking on a button or link on another page.

property.name: dfs.xframe.value
property.description: This configration value allows user to specify the value for the X-FRAME-OPTIONS. The possible values for this field are DENY, SAMEORIGIN and ALLOW-FROM. Any other value will throw an exception when namenode and datanodes are starting up.

property.name: dfs.balancer.keytab.enabled
property.description: Set to true to enable login using a keytab for Kerberized Hadoop.

property.name: dfs.balancer.address
property.description: The hostname used for a keytab based Kerberos login. Keytab based login can be enabled with dfs.balancer.keytab.enabled.

property.name: dfs.balancer.keytab.file
property.description: The keytab file used by the Balancer to login as its service principal. The principal name is configured with dfs.balancer.kerberos.principal. Keytab based login can be enabled with dfs.balancer.keytab.enabled.

property.name: dfs.balancer.kerberos.principal
property.description: The Balancer principal. This is typically set to balancer/_HOST@REALM.TLD. The Balancer will substitute _HOST with its own fully qualified hostname at startup. The _HOST placeholder allows using the same configuration setting on different servers. Keytab based login can be enabled with dfs.balancer.keytab.enabled.

property.name: dfs.http.client.retry.policy.enabled
property.description: If "true", enable the retry policy of WebHDFS client. If "false", retry policy is turned off. Enabling the retry policy can be quite useful while using WebHDFS to copy large files between clusters that could timeout, or copy files between HA clusters that could failover during the copy.

property.name: dfs.http.client.retry.policy.spec
property.description: Specify a policy of multiple linear random retry for WebHDFS client, e.g. given pairs of number of retries and sleep time (n0, t0), (n1, t1), ..., the first n0 retries sleep t0 milliseconds on average, the following n1 retries sleep t1 milliseconds on average, and so on.

property.name: dfs.http.client.failover.max.attempts
property.description: Specify the max number of failover attempts for WebHDFS client in case of network exception.

property.name: dfs.http.client.retry.max.attempts
property.description: Specify the max number of retry attempts for WebHDFS client, if the difference between retried attempts and failovered attempts is larger than the max number of retry attempts, there will be no more retries.

property.name: dfs.http.client.failover.sleep.base.millis
property.description: Specify the base amount of time in milliseconds upon which the exponentially increased sleep time between retries or failovers is calculated for WebHDFS client.

property.name: dfs.http.client.failover.sleep.max.millis
property.description: Specify the upper bound of sleep time in milliseconds between retries or failovers for WebHDFS client.

property.name: dfs.namenode.hosts.provider.classname
property.description: The class that provides access for host files. org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.HostFileManager is used by default which loads files specified by dfs.hosts and dfs.hosts.exclude. If org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.CombinedHostFileManager is used, it will load the JSON file defined in dfs.hosts. To change class name, nn restart is required. "dfsadmin -refreshNodes" only refreshes the configuration files used by the class.

property.name: datanode.https.port
property.description: HTTPS port for DataNode.

property.name: dfs.balancer.dispatcherThreads
property.description: Size of the thread pool for the HDFS balancer block mover. dispatchExecutor

property.name: dfs.balancer.movedWinWidth
property.description: Window of time in ms for the HDFS balancer tracking blocks and its locations.

property.name: dfs.balancer.moverThreads
property.description: Thread pool size for executing block moves. moverThreadAllocator

property.name: dfs.balancer.max-size-to-move
property.description: Maximum number of bytes that can be moved by the balancer in a single thread.

property.name: dfs.balancer.getBlocks.min-block-size
property.description: Minimum block threshold size in bytes to ignore when fetching a source's block list.

property.name: dfs.balancer.getBlocks.size
property.description: Total size in bytes of Datanode blocks to get when fetching a source's block list.

property.name: dfs.balancer.block-move.timeout
property.description: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds for a block to move. If this is set greater than 0, Balancer will stop waiting for a block move completion after this time. In typical clusters, a 3 to 5 minute timeout is reasonable. If timeout happens to a large proportion of block moves, this needs to be increased. It could also be that too much work is dispatched and many nodes are constantly exceeding the bandwidth limit as a result. In that case, other balancer parameters might need to be adjusted. It is disabled (0) by default.

property.name: dfs.balancer.max-no-move-interval
property.description: If this specified amount of time has elapsed and no block has been moved out of a source DataNode, on more effort will be made to move blocks out of this DataNode in the current Balancer iteration.

property.name: dfs.block.invalidate.limit
property.description: The maximum number of invalidate blocks sent by namenode to a datanode per heartbeat deletion command. This property works with "dfs.namenode.invalidate.work.pct.per.iteration" to throttle block deletions.

property.name: dfs.block.misreplication.processing.limit
property.description: Maximum number of blocks to process for initializing replication queues.

property.name: dfs.block.placement.ec.classname
property.description: Placement policy class for striped files. Defaults to BlockPlacementPolicyRackFaultTolerant.class

property.name: dfs.block.replicator.classname
property.description: Class representing block placement policy for non-striped files. There are four block placement policies currently being supported: BlockPlacementPolicyDefault, BlockPlacementPolicyWithNodeGroup, BlockPlacementPolicyRackFaultTolerant and BlockPlacementPolicyWithUpgradeDomain. BlockPlacementPolicyDefault chooses the desired number of targets for placing block replicas in a default way. BlockPlacementPolicyWithNodeGroup places block replicas on environment with node-group layer. BlockPlacementPolicyRackFaultTolerant places the replicas to more racks. BlockPlacementPolicyWithUpgradeDomain places block replicas that honors upgrade domain policy. The details of placing replicas are documented in the javadoc of the corresponding policy classes. The default policy is BlockPlacementPolicyDefault, and the corresponding class is org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicyDefault.

property.name: dfs.blockreport.incremental.intervalMsec
property.description: If set to a positive integer, the value in ms to wait between sending incremental block reports from the Datanode to the Namenode.

property.name: dfs.checksum.type
property.description: Checksum type

property.name: dfs.client.block.write.locateFollowingBlock.retries
property.description: Number of retries to use when finding the next block during HDFS writes.

property.name: dfs.client.failover.proxy.provider
property.description: The prefix (plus a required nameservice ID) for the class name of the configured Failover proxy provider for the host. For more detailed information, please consult the "Configuration Details" section of the HDFS High Availability documentation.

property.name: dfs.client.key.provider.cache.expiry
property.description: DFS client security key cache expiration in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.client.max.block.acquire.failures
property.description: Maximum failures allowed when trying to get block information from a specific datanode.

property.name: dfs.client.read.prefetch.size
property.description: The number of bytes for the DFSClient will fetch from the Namenode during a read operation. Defaults to 10 * ${dfs.blocksize}.

property.name: dfs.client.read.short.circuit.replica.stale.threshold.ms
property.description: Threshold in milliseconds for read entries during short-circuit local reads.

property.name: dfs.client.read.shortcircuit.buffer.size
property.description: Buffer size in bytes for short-circuit local reads.

property.name: dfs.client.read.striped.threadpool.size
property.description: The maximum number of threads used for parallel reading in striped layout.

property.name: dfs.client.replica.accessor.builder.classes
property.description: Comma-separated classes for building ReplicaAccessor. If the classes are specified, client will use external BlockReader that uses the ReplicaAccessor built by the builder.

property.name: dfs.client.retry.interval-ms.get-last-block-length
property.description: Retry interval in milliseconds to wait between retries in getting block lengths from the datanodes.

property.name: dfs.client.retry.max.attempts
property.description: Max retry attempts for DFSClient talking to namenodes.

property.name: dfs.client.retry.policy.enabled
property.description: If true, turns on DFSClient retry policy.

property.name: dfs.client.retry.policy.spec
property.description: Set to pairs of timeouts and retries for DFSClient.

property.name: dfs.client.retry.times.get-last-block-length
property.description: Number of retries for calls to fetchLocatedBlocksAndGetLastBlockLength().

property.name: dfs.client.retry.window.base
property.description: Base time window in ms for DFSClient retries. For each retry attempt, this value is extended linearly (e.g. 3000 ms for first attempt and first retry, 6000 ms for second retry, 9000 ms for third retry, etc.).

property.name: dfs.client.socket-timeout
property.description: Default timeout value in milliseconds for all sockets.

property.name: dfs.client.socketcache.capacity
property.description: Socket cache capacity (in entries) for short-circuit reads.

property.name: dfs.client.socketcache.expiryMsec
property.description: Socket cache expiration for short-circuit reads in msec.

property.name: dfs.client.test.drop.namenode.response.number
property.description: The number of Namenode responses dropped by DFSClient for each RPC call. Used for testing the NN retry cache.

property.name: dfs.client.hedged.read.threadpool.size
property.description: Support 'hedged' reads in DFSClient. To enable this feature, set the parameter to a positive number. The threadpool size is how many threads to dedicate to the running of these 'hedged', concurrent reads in your client.

property.name: dfs.client.hedged.read.threshold.millis
property.description: Configure 'hedged' reads in DFSClient. This is the number of milliseconds to wait before starting up a 'hedged' read.

property.name: dfs.client.write.byte-array-manager.count-limit
property.description: The maximum number of arrays allowed for each array length.

property.name: dfs.client.write.byte-array-manager.count-reset-time-period-ms
property.description: The time period in milliseconds that the allocation count for each array length is reset to zero if there is no increment.

property.name: dfs.client.write.byte-array-manager.count-threshold
property.description: The count threshold for each array length so that a manager is created only after the allocation count exceeds the threshold. In other words, the particular array length is not managed until the allocation count exceeds the threshold.

property.name: dfs.client.write.byte-array-manager.enabled
property.description: If true, enables byte array manager used by DFSOutputStream.

property.name: dfs.client.write.max-packets-in-flight
property.description: The maximum number of DFSPackets allowed in flight.

property.name: dfs.content-summary.limit
property.description: The maximum content summary counts allowed in one locking period. 0 or a negative number means no limit (i.e. no yielding).

property.name: dfs.content-summary.sleep-microsec
property.description: The length of time in microseconds to put the thread to sleep, between reaquiring the locks in content summary computation.

property.name: dfs.data.transfer.client.tcpnodelay
property.description: If true, set TCP_NODELAY to sockets for transferring data from DFS client.

property.name: dfs.data.transfer.server.tcpnodelay
property.description: If true, set TCP_NODELAY to sockets for transferring data between Datanodes.

property.name: dfs.datanode.balance.max.concurrent.moves
property.description: Maximum number of threads for Datanode balancer pending moves. This value is reconfigurable via the "dfsadmin -reconfig" command.

property.name: dfs.datanode.fsdataset.factory
property.description: The class name for the underlying storage that stores replicas for a Datanode. Defaults to org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.FsDatasetFactory.

property.name: dfs.datanode.fsdataset.volume.choosing.policy
property.description: The class name of the policy for choosing volumes in the list of directories. Defaults to org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.RoundRobinVolumeChoosingPolicy. If you would like to take into account available disk space, set the value to "org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.AvailableSpaceVolumeChoosingPolicy".

property.name: dfs.datanode.hostname
property.description: Optional. The hostname for the Datanode containing this configuration file. Will be different for each machine. Defaults to current hostname.

property.name: dfs.datanode.lazywriter.interval.sec
property.description: Interval in seconds for Datanodes for lazy persist writes.

property.name: dfs.datanode.network.counts.cache.max.size
property.description: The maximum number of entries the datanode per-host network error count cache may contain.

property.name: dfs.datanode.oob.timeout-ms
property.description: Timeout value when sending OOB response for each OOB type, which are OOB_RESTART, OOB_RESERVED1, OOB_RESERVED2, and OOB_RESERVED3, respectively. Currently, only OOB_RESTART is used.

property.name: dfs.datanode.parallel.volumes.load.threads.num
property.description: Maximum number of threads to use for upgrading data directories. The default value is the number of storage directories in the DataNode.

property.name: dfs.datanode.ram.disk.replica.tracker
property.description: Name of the class implementing the RamDiskReplicaTracker interface. Defaults to org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl.RamDiskReplicaLruTracker.

property.name: dfs.datanode.restart.replica.expiration
property.description: During shutdown for restart, the amount of time in seconds budgeted for datanode restart.

property.name: dfs.datanode.socket.reuse.keepalive
property.description: The window of time in ms before the DataXceiver closes a socket for a single request. If a second request occurs within that window, the socket can be reused.

property.name: dfs.datanode.socket.write.timeout
property.description: Timeout in ms for clients socket writes to DataNodes.

property.name: dfs.datanode.sync.behind.writes.in.background
property.description: If set to true, then sync_file_range() system call will occur asynchronously. This property is only valid when the property dfs.datanode.sync.behind.writes is true.

property.name: dfs.datanode.transferTo.allowed
property.description: If false, break block transfers on 32-bit machines greater than or equal to 2GB into smaller chunks.

property.name: dfs.ha.fencing.methods
property.description: A list of scripts or Java classes which will be used to fence the Active NameNode during a failover. See the HDFS High Availability documentation for details on automatic HA configuration.

property.name: dfs.ha.standby.checkpoints
property.description: If true, a NameNode in Standby state periodically takes a checkpoint of the namespace, saves it to its local storage and then upload to the remote NameNode.

property.name: dfs.ha.zkfc.port
property.description: The port number that the zookeeper failover controller RPC server binds to.

property.name: dfs.journalnode.edits.dir
property.description: The directory where the journal edit files are stored.

property.name: dfs.journalnode.enable.sync
property.description: If true, the journal nodes wil sync with each other. The journal nodes will periodically gossip with other journal nodes to compare edit log manifests and if they detect any missing log segment, they will download it from the other journal nodes.

property.name: dfs.journalnode.sync.interval
property.description: Time interval, in milliseconds, between two Journal Node syncs. This configuration takes effect only if the journalnode sync is enabled by setting the configuration parameter dfs.journalnode.enable.sync to true.

property.name: dfs.journalnode.kerberos.internal.spnego.principal
property.description: Kerberos SPNEGO principal name used by the journal node.

property.name: dfs.journalnode.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal name for the journal node.

property.name: dfs.journalnode.keytab.file
property.description: Kerberos keytab file for the journal node.

property.name: dfs.ls.limit
property.description: Limit the number of files printed by ls. If less or equal to zero, at most DFS_LIST_LIMIT_DEFAULT (= 1000) will be printed.

property.name: dfs.mover.movedWinWidth
property.description: The minimum time interval, in milliseconds, that a block can be moved to another location again.

property.name: dfs.mover.moverThreads
property.description: Configure the balancer's mover thread pool size.

property.name: dfs.mover.retry.max.attempts
property.description: The maximum number of retries before the mover consider the move failed.

property.name: dfs.mover.keytab.enabled
property.description: Set to true to enable login using a keytab for Kerberized Hadoop.

property.name: dfs.mover.address
property.description: The hostname used for a keytab based Kerberos login. Keytab based login can be enabled with dfs.mover.keytab.enabled.

property.name: dfs.mover.keytab.file
property.description: The keytab file used by the Mover to login as its service principal. The principal name is configured with dfs.mover.kerberos.principal. Keytab based login can be enabled with dfs.mover.keytab.enabled.

property.name: dfs.mover.kerberos.principal
property.description: The Mover principal. This is typically set to mover/_HOST@REALM.TLD. The Mover will substitute _HOST with its own fully qualified hostname at startup. The _HOST placeholder allows using the same configuration setting on different servers. Keytab based login can be enabled with dfs.mover.keytab.enabled.

property.name: dfs.mover.max-no-move-interval
property.description: If this specified amount of time has elapsed and no block has been moved out of a source DataNode, on more effort will be made to move blocks out of this DataNode in the current Mover iteration.

property.name: dfs.namenode.audit.log.async
property.description: If true, enables asynchronous audit log.

property.name: dfs.namenode.audit.log.token.tracking.id
property.description: If true, adds a tracking ID for all audit log events.

property.name: dfs.namenode.available-space-block-placement-policy.balanced-space-preference-fraction
property.description: Only used when the dfs.block.replicator.classname is set to org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.AvailableSpaceBlockPlacementPolicy. Special value between 0 and 1, noninclusive. Increases chance of placing blocks on Datanodes with less disk space used.

property.name: dfs.namenode.backup.dnrpc-address
property.description: Service RPC address for the backup Namenode.

property.name: dfs.namenode.delegation.token.always-use
property.description: For testing. Setting to true always allows the DT secret manager to be used, even if security is disabled.

property.name: dfs.namenode.edits.asynclogging
property.description: If set to true, enables asynchronous edit logs in the Namenode. If set to false, the Namenode uses the traditional synchronous edit logs.

property.name: dfs.namenode.edits.dir.minimum
property.description:
dfs.namenode.edits.dir includes both required directories (specified by dfs.namenode.edits.dir.required) and optional directories.
The number of usable optional directories must be greater than or equal to this property. If the number of usable optional directories falls below dfs.namenode.edits.dir.minimum, HDFS will issue an error.
This property defaults to 1.

property.name: dfs.namenode.edits.journal-plugin
property.description: When FSEditLog is creating JournalManagers from dfs.namenode.edits.dir, and it encounters a URI with a schema different to "file" it loads the name of the implementing class from "dfs.namenode.edits.journal-plugin.[schema]". This class must implement JournalManager and have a constructor which takes (Configuration, URI).

property.name: dfs.namenode.file.close.num-committed-allowed
property.description: Normally a file can only be closed with all its blocks are committed. When this value is set to a positive integer N, a file can be closed when N blocks are committed and the rest complete.

property.name: dfs.namenode.inode.attributes.provider.class
property.description: Name of class to use for delegating HDFS authorization.

property.name: dfs.namenode.inode.attributes.provider.bypass.users
property.description: A list of user principals (in secure cluster) or user names (in insecure cluster) for whom the external attributes provider will be bypassed for all operations. This means file attributes stored in HDFS instead of the external provider will be used for permission checking and be returned when requested.

property.name: dfs.namenode.max-num-blocks-to-log
property.description: Puts a limit on the number of blocks printed to the log by the Namenode after a block report.

property.name: dfs.namenode.max.op.size
property.description: Maximum opcode size in bytes.

property.name: dfs.namenode.missing.checkpoint.periods.before.shutdown
property.description: The number of checkpoint period windows (as defined by the property dfs.namenode.checkpoint.period) allowed by the Namenode to perform saving the namespace before shutdown.

property.name: dfs.namenode.name.cache.threshold
property.description: Frequently accessed files that are accessed more times than this threshold are cached in the FSDirectory nameCache.

property.name: dfs.namenode.replication.max-streams
property.description: Hard limit for the number of highest-priority replication streams.

property.name: dfs.namenode.replication.max-streams-hard-limit
property.description: Hard limit for all replication streams.

property.name: dfs.namenode.reconstruction.pending.timeout-sec
property.description: Timeout in seconds for block reconstruction. If this value is 0 or less, then it will default to 5 minutes.

property.name: dfs.namenode.stale.datanode.minimum.interval
property.description: Minimum number of missed heartbeats intervals for a datanode to be marked stale by the Namenode. The actual interval is calculated as (dfs.namenode.stale.datanode.minimum.interval * dfs.heartbeat.interval) in seconds. If this value is greater than the property dfs.namenode.stale.datanode.interval, then the calculated value above is used.

property.name: dfs.namenode.storageinfo.defragment.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout value in ms for the StorageInfo compaction run.

property.name: dfs.namenode.storageinfo.defragment.interval.ms
property.description: The thread for checking the StorageInfo for defragmentation will run periodically. The time between runs is determined by this property.

property.name: dfs.namenode.storageinfo.defragment.ratio
property.description: The defragmentation threshold for the StorageInfo.

property.name: dfs.namenode.snapshot.capture.openfiles
property.description: If true, snapshots taken will have an immutable shared copy of the open files that have valid leases. Even after the open files grow or shrink in size, snapshot will always have the previous point-in-time version of the open files, just like all other closed files. Default is false. Note: The file length captured for open files in snapshot is whats recorded in NameNode at the time of snapshot and it may be shorter than what the client has written till then. In order to capture the latest length, the client can call hflush/hsync with the flag SyncFlag.UPDATE_LENGTH on the open files handles.

property.name: dfs.namenode.snapshot.skip.capture.accesstime-only-change
property.description: If accessTime of a file/directory changed but there is no other modification made to the file/directory, the changed accesstime will not be captured in next snapshot. However, if there is other modification made to the file/directory, the latest access time will be captured together with the modification in next snapshot.

property.name: dfs.namenode.snapshotdiff.allow.snap-root-descendant
property.description: If enabled, snapshotDiff command can be run for any descendant directory under a snapshot root directory and the diff calculation will be scoped to the given descendant directory. Otherwise, snapshot diff command can only be run for a snapshot root directory.

property.name: dfs.pipeline.ecn
property.description: If true, allows ECN (explicit congestion notification) from the Datanode.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.accept-recovery.timeout.ms
property.description: Quorum timeout in milliseconds during accept phase of recovery/synchronization for a specific segment.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.finalize-segment.timeout.ms
property.description: Quorum timeout in milliseconds during finalizing for a specific segment.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.get-journal-state.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout in milliseconds when calling getJournalState(). JournalNodes.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.new-epoch.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout in milliseconds when getting an epoch number for write access to JournalNodes.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.prepare-recovery.timeout.ms
property.description: Quorum timeout in milliseconds during preparation phase of recovery/synchronization for a specific segment.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.queued-edits.limit.mb
property.description: Queue size in MB for quorum journal edits.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.select-input-streams.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout in milliseconds for accepting streams from JournalManagers.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.start-segment.timeout.ms
property.description: Quorum timeout in milliseconds for starting a log segment.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.write-txns.timeout.ms
property.description: Write timeout in milliseconds when writing to a quorum of remote journals.

property.name: dfs.quota.by.storage.type.enabled
property.description: If true, enables quotas based on storage type.

property.name: dfs.secondary.namenode.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal name for the Secondary NameNode.

property.name: dfs.secondary.namenode.keytab.file
property.description: Kerberos keytab file for the Secondary NameNode.

property.name: dfs.web.authentication.filter
property.description: Authentication filter class used for WebHDFS.

property.name: dfs.web.authentication.simple.anonymous.allowed
property.description: If true, allow anonymous user to access WebHDFS. Set to false to disable anonymous authentication.

property.name: dfs.web.ugi
property.description: dfs.web.ugi is deprecated. Use hadoop.http.staticuser.user instead.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.netty.high.watermark
property.description: High watermark configuration to Netty for Datanode WebHdfs.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.netty.low.watermark
property.description: Low watermark configuration to Netty for Datanode WebHdfs.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.oauth2.access.token.provider
property.description: Access token provider class for WebHDFS using OAuth2. Defaults to org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.web.oauth2.ConfCredentialBasedAccessTokenProvider.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.oauth2.client.id
property.description: Client id used to obtain access token with either credential or refresh token.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.oauth2.enabled
property.description: If true, enables OAuth2 in WebHDFS

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.oauth2.refresh.url
property.description: URL against which to post for obtaining bearer token with either credential or refresh token.

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.keypassword
property.description: Keystore key password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.location
property.description: Keystore location for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.password
property.description: Keystore password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.truststore.location
property.description: Truststore location for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.truststore.password
property.description: Truststore password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.max.disk.throughputInMBperSec
property.description: Maximum disk bandwidth used by diskbalancer during read from a source disk. The unit is MB/sec.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.block.tolerance.percent
property.description: When a disk balancer copy operation is proceeding, the datanode is still active. So it might not be possible to move the exactly specified amount of data. So tolerance allows us to define a percentage which defines a good enough move.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.max.disk.errors
property.description: During a block move from a source to destination disk, we might encounter various errors. This defines how many errors we can tolerate before we declare a move between 2 disks (or a step) has failed.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.enabled
property.description: This enables the diskbalancer feature on a cluster. By default, disk balancer is disabled.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.plan.threshold.percent
property.description: The percentage threshold value for volume Data Density in a plan. If the absolute value of volume Data Density which is out of threshold value in a node, it means that the volumes corresponding to the disks should do the balancing in the plan. The default value is 10.

property.name: dfs.lock.suppress.warning.interval
property.description: Instrumentation reporting long critical sections will suppress consecutive warnings within this interval.

property.name: httpfs.buffer.size
property.description: The size buffer to be used when creating or opening httpfs filesystem IO stream.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.use.ipc.callq
property.description: Enables routing of webhdfs calls through rpc call queue

property.name: dfs.datanode.disk.check.min.gap
property.description: The minimum gap between two successive checks of the same DataNode volume. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.datanode.disk.check.timeout
property.description: Maximum allowed time for a disk check to complete during DataNode startup. If the check does not complete within this time interval then the disk is declared as failed. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.use.dfs.network.topology
property.description: Enables DFSNetworkTopology to choose nodes for placing replicas.

property.name: dfs.qjm.operations.timeout
property.description: Common key to set timeout for related operations in QuorumJournalManager. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.reformat.disabled
property.description: Disable reformat of NameNode. If it's value is set to "true" and metadata directories already exist then attempt to format NameNode will throw NameNodeFormatException.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.default.nameserviceId
property.description: Nameservice identifier of the default subcluster to monitor.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.rpc.enable
property.description: If true, the RPC service to handle client requests in the router is enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.rpc-address
property.description: RPC address that handles all clients requests. The value of this property will take the form of router-host1:rpc-port.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.rpc-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the RPC server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of dfs.federation.router.rpc-address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.handler.count
property.description: The number of server threads for the router to handle RPC requests from clients.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.handler.queue.size
property.description: The size of the queue for the number of handlers to handle RPC client requests.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.reader.count
property.description: The number of readers for the router to handle RPC client requests.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.reader.queue.size
property.description: The size of the queue for the number of readers for the router to handle RPC client requests.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connection.pool-size
property.description: Size of the pool of connections from the router to namenodes.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connection.clean.ms
property.description: Time interval, in milliseconds, to check if the connection pool should remove unused connections.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connection.pool.clean.ms
property.description: Time interval, in milliseconds, to check if the connection manager should remove unused connection pools.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.metrics.enable
property.description: If the metrics in the router are enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.metrics.class
property.description: Class to monitor the RPC system in the router. It must implement the RouterRpcMonitor interface.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.admin.enable
property.description: If true, the RPC admin service to handle client requests in the router is enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.admin-address
property.description: RPC address that handles the admin requests. The value of this property will take the form of router-host1:rpc-port.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.admin-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the RPC admin server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of dfs.federation.router.admin-address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.admin.handler.count
property.description: The number of server threads for the router to handle RPC requests from admin.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.http-address
property.description: HTTP address that handles the web requests to the Router. The value of this property will take the form of router-host1:http-port.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.http-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the HTTP server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of dfs.federation.router.http-address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.https-address
property.description: HTTPS address that handles the web requests to the Router. The value of this property will take the form of router-host1:https-port.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.https-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the HTTPS server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of dfs.federation.router.https-address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.http.enable
property.description: If the HTTP service to handle client requests in the router is enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.metrics.enable
property.description: If the metrics service in the router is enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.file.resolver.client.class
property.description: Class to resolve files to subclusters.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.namenode.resolver.client.class
property.description: Class to resolve the namenode for a subcluster.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.enable
property.description: If true, the Router connects to the State Store.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.serializer
property.description: Class to serialize State Store records.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.driver.class
property.description: Class to implement the State Store. By default it uses the local disk.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.connection.test
property.description: How often to check for the connection to the State Store in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.cache.ttl
property.description: How often to refresh the State Store caches in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.membership.expiration
property.description: Expiration time in milliseconds for a membership record.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.heartbeat.enable
property.description: If true, the Router heartbeats into the State Store.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.heartbeat.interval
property.description: How often the Router should heartbeat into the State Store in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.monitor.namenode
property.description: The identifier of the namenodes to monitor and heartbeat.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.monitor.localnamenode.enable
property.description: If true, the Router should monitor the namenode in the local machine.

property.name: dfs.reformat.disabled
property.description: Disable reformat of NameNode. If it's value is set to "true" and metadata directories already exist then attempt to format NameNode will throw NameNodeFormatException.
